newsitem.title: UK: Hardy Oil buys stake in Indian oil firm.
newsitem.headline: Hardy Oil buys stake in Indian oil firm.

text.p: Hardy Oil & Gas Plc on Wednesday announced it had bought a 15.5 percent stake in Hindustan Oil Exploration Company Ltd (HOEC) from India for a total 2.9 million pounds.
Hardy said more Indian deals were in the pipeline, but these would likely take the form of acquisitions of drilling licences and new acreage positions.
There is not much scope for further corporate deals as HOEC is the only independent listed oil exploration and production firm in India, Hardy's finance director John van der Welle told Reuters.
"The fact this is a corporate transaction is interesting, but it is probably unique as well for us," said Van der Welle.

Hardy will acquire new shares in HOEC as will two Indian institutions, Housing and Development and Finance Corp and Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services Ltd, which will together also have a 15.5 percent stake in HOEC.
Hardy is already working with HOEC in the PY-3 oil field, offshore south east India.
